title: Installing Requirements and Dependencies
description: The easiest way to install the dependencies natively on Microsoft Windows is to use the [`Chocolatey` package manager](https://chocolatey.org/). If you prefer to install those manually then simply download the required packages from their respective websites.

steps.title: Set up environment variables for proxies
steps.description:
If you're behind a corporate firewall, you'll likely need to specify a proxy to get access to internet resources:
```
set HTTP_PROXY=http://user:password@proxy.mycompany.com:1234
set HTTPS_PROXY=http://user:password@proxy.mycompany.com:1234
```

You can avoid typing these `set` commands every time by placing them inside a `.cmd` file and running that every time you open a Command Prompt.

steps.title: Install Chocolatey
steps.description: Install `Chocolatey` by following the [install instructions on the `Chocolatey` website](https://chocolatey.org/install).

steps.title: Disable confirmation
steps.description:
(Optionally) disable global confirmation to avoid having to add the `-y` flag to all chocolatey commands:
```
choco feature enable -n allowGlobalConfirmation
```

steps.title: Install cmake
steps.description:
Install CMake by running:
```
choco install -y cmake --installargs 'ADD_CMAKE_TO_PATH=System'
```

steps.title: Install tools
steps.description:
Install the rest of the tools:
```
choco install git python ninja dtc-msys2 gperf doxygen.install
```

steps.title: Open cmd.exe
steps.description: Open a Command Prompt (`cmd.exe`) as a **regular user**.

steps.title: Clone zephyr source
steps.description:
Clone a copy of the Zephyr source into your home directory using `git`:
```
cd %userprofile%
git clone https://github.com/zephyrproject-rtos/zephyr.git
```

steps.title: Install python modules
steps.description:
Install the required python modules:
```
cd %userprofile%\zephyr
pip3 install -r scripts/requirements.txt
```

steps.title: Install cross compiler toolchain for x86
steps.description: For cross-compiling for x86 targets, install the 2017 Windows host [ISSM toolchain from the Intel Developer Zone](https://software.intel.com/en-us/articles/issm-toolchain-only-download). Use your web browser to download the toolchain's ``tar.gz`` file. You can then use 7-Zip or a similar tool to extract it into a destination folder.

steps.title: Install cross compiler toolchain for ARM
steps.description: For cross-compiling for ARM targets, install [GNU ARM Embedded from the ARM developer website](). (install to `c:\gnuarmemb`).

steps.title: Environment variables for ISSM
steps.description:
Within the Command Prompt, set up environment variables for the ISSM toolchain:
 ```
 set ZEPHYR_TOOLCHAIN_VARIANT=issm
 set ISSM_INSTALLATION_PATH=c:issm0-toolchain-windows-2017-01-25
 ```

steps.title: Environment variables for GNU ARM
steps.description:
Within the Command Prompt, set up environment variables for the GNU ARM toolchain:
 ```
 set ZEPHYR_TOOLCHAIN_VARIANT=gnuarmemb
 set GNUARMEMB_TOOLCHAIN_PATH=c:gnuarmemb
 ```
